head.title: Sept. 10-16; Gay Rights, Here and There

hedline.hl1: Sept. 10-16; Gay Rights, Here and There

block.p: Vermont -- the current ground zero for this nation's gay-rights struggle -- remains divided over its new civil-unions law, as a number of the bill's backers were ousted in primaries. And that mixed message was echoed across the Atlantic. The Dutch decided to allow gay marriages and other rights surpassing those in any other country. But hundreds of gay Americans on a cruise were barred by Turkish police from tourist spots on the Aegean, prompting diplomatic outcries. (They were later welcomed in Istanbul.) And an official on the Greek island of Lesbos, of all places, tried to turn away a group of British lesbians, saying that his town was not the ''paradise of gay love'' promised by the tour operator.
